a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

a.span: Division of Child Protection and Permanency
Just Kids Before & After School Care
Rights Of Persons With Handicaps or Disabilities

p.span: Greetings! On this page we will be trying our best to continually update our community. Below will be information, resources, and updates.

A few tips: Provide a workspace free of distraction to the best of your ability. Research and supplement. Try the programs the students are using to become proficient. Most importantly, set a high expectation and support it with structure and routine. (See example below) Make every effort to get the student online as this will offer a more enriching experience that can be modified easily by teachers working remotely.Â
This will pass and we want our students to continue to grow and learn through this. They will remember this for the rest of their lives. Letâs not make it a traumatic experience, but something we lived through and used to become stronger and better people.
Thank you to everyone who has reached out, helped, or offered us assistance. Kind messages shared have also been greatly appreciated. Magnolia Strong!

span.strong:
April 16, 2020
Workload across the week moving forward:

Teachers will be assigning work and hosting meetings with classes Monday through Thursday. Friday will be more of a focus on a âCatch Up Dayâ for students or a âCheck in Day,â with the classes. In doing this, teachers will focus on grading student work, reviewing progress, and also reaching out to students who are having trouble with or not submitting work.
Fridays is also the day students can focus on specials if they are caught up.Â

please be reminded school work and attendance is not optional. At this point the district has attempted to reach out to families in the community we have had difficulty getting online to assist. The district is documenting attendance, missing work, and attempts made to assist. Please do not participate in educational neglect and work with us to make sure your child is still recieving the best education we can provide during the crisis.Â

strong.br:
Thank you everyone for working so hard and coming together as a community. We will continue to try and make this smoother and more effective with each week.
We Are Magnolia Strong!

li.span: If people specifically requested materials ahead of time because of problems connecting digitally there will be packet pickups Tuesday (3/24) 9-12PM.Â Please speak to your teacher via dojo/email.Â Let us know if there are issues we can help with for possible other pickup times.Â
At this time no work will be physically handed in. Please take screen shots, or submit electronically. Communicate with the teacher.Â
Lunches will be grab and go style at the side entrance of the main driveway.Â
We will just need the students name and ID
Lunches will be served, today LUNCHES WILL BE AVAILABLE FROM 11-12PM on Monday and Wednesday.Â These pickups will provide enough food for multiple days.

After 3PM today the building will be closed to all community members. Some essential employees may be working,but no one will be permitted on the grounds or in the building. The next open hours for packet pickup currently will be Monday 3/23 9-12PM if anyone has a need.Â

A few people have reported difficulty logging into google, zearn, and other applications. It is highly recommended you write down all your log-ins and passwords somewhere safe. Also, if you change any passwords please let the childâs teacher know so they can record it. Any help with online will go through the teacher first and then they will initiate help at the next level.Â

ul.li:
Websites and applications
when in doubt, use the schools "links" tab on its website to connect. You must use certain links for applications such as Edmentum that are tied to Magnolia only.Â A google search will not log you into our schools account system.Â

For families in need of internet
Comcast is currently offering free wifi if you have an Xfinity hotspot near you. You'd just need to connect to "xfinitywifi" in the list of networks and accept the terms and confitions. The form should pop-up either automatically or when you open an internet browser. Please note, Xfinity home networks are not open to the public and are different from the hotspots mentioned here.
For low income families, Comcast is offering 60 days of complimentary Internet Essentials service (an internet service by Comcast) when you sign up as a new customer. This would normally be $9.95/month.
Spectrum is offering two free months of internet if your family has a student who has been affected by school closings. If Spectrum is offered in your area, this is another choice you have.

Students in 5th-8th grade will have access to the email provided by the school. It should be relayed that these emails are retained by the district and can be seen or read at anytime. Any misuse or inappropriate language or reports can and will be investigated and face disciplinary action.Â

At this time Magnolia is unable to loan devices out to parents or students.Â We have limited availability and no insurance on the devices. If this changes we will let the community know. We are continuing to look for ways to offer this while gauranteeing they are returned and in working order.Â

span.div: We are all well aware of what an uneasy time this may be for everyone in our community.Â I am constantly researching and staying up to date on all of the latest findings with COVID-19.Â I wanted to let you know that I will be available to families/students each day should any medical questions/concernsÂ arise, whether virus related or not.Â I miss the students so much so please also reach out just to say âhello,â as I would love to hear how they are doing!Â I will be available Monday-Friday 8:30am-12:30pm. I can be contacted viaÂ email- smarlys@magnoliaschools.orgÂ or via phone at 856-375-8839. Stay safe and healthy during this time and please feel free to contact me if you have any questionsÂ or concerns.

strong.span: CDC is now recommending wearing cloth face coverings in public settings to prevent the spread of the virus. Here is an article from their website with helpful hints on how to make your own face mask and how to care for them.Â Â
Just came across this and though it may be a cute idea to do with your kids for keepsakes. COVID-19 Time Capsule:Â Â

span.div: Apple Inc. â in partnership with the White House Coronavirus Task Force and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) â released an app and website that guides Americans through a series of questions about their health and exposure to determine if they should seek care for COVID-19 symptoms.Â The tool provides CDC recommendations on next steps including guidance on social distancing and self-isolating, how to closely monitor symptoms, recommendations on testing, and when to contact a medical provider.Â The app is available for free and downloaded from the Apple App store.Â It can also be access atÂ www.apple.com/covid19.
span.p: We realize how new/scary/stressful this new adventure may be. Here is a great YouTube channel for all types of fun kids yoga that may help your children unwind.

div.div:
The Speech-Language Services Google classroom is open to ALL parents in the school district. I will be posting videos of me reading stories and will have resources for fostering Speech and Language skills that will be beneficial to all students.
Here is the code for my classroom : 7cg5hym

Hello Magnolia Families!
We all know that the next few weeks are going to be a transition for many reasons. We, as educators, are trying our best to prepare our students and families with materials for remote learning. We, as parents are trying our best to make this transition to remote learning and social distancing, as normal as possible. As a social worker, I am mindful of how this change in routine, can pose some challenges for both kids and parents.
Please feel free to join my Google Classroom for activities, resources or just to ask some questions or check in. Here is my class code: nlhcljh

Feel free to use applications like ZOOM to get face to face time. This is healthy.Â Zoom offers a closed circuit video system that only people invited will see. It allows for control that other platforms do not. **Many students will use social media, however the district advises parents to check this frequently and be aware of the dangers that come with these platforms. Many discpline related issues do involve applications such as snap, tiktok, etc. These programs are open to the public and content is not filtered.Â
